name: Blue Diesel
description: Daughter of indica-dominant Blueberry and sativa-dominant NYC Diesel, Blue Diesel (also known as Blue City Diesel) falls on the slightly indica side with a pleasant, moderate to long-lasting body buzz. Thanks to its Blueberry genetics, this flower emanates a light berry aroma that is smooth, expansive, and fast-acting. This strain is optimal for daytime and comes with little to no fatigue or increased appetite, making it a desirable option for medical marijuana patients. Originally produced by Breeder’s Choice, this plant may provide just the relaxation you need.
descriptionPlain: Daughter of indica-dominant Blueberry and sativa-dominant NYC Diesel, Blue Diesel (also known as Blue City Diesel) falls on the slightly indica side with a pleasant, moderate to long-lasting body buzz. Thanks to its Blueberry genetics, this flower emanates a light berry aroma that is smooth, expansive, and fast-acting. This strain is optimal for daytime and comes with little to no fatigue or increased appetite, making it a desirable option for medical marijuana patients. Originally produced by Breeder’s Choice, this plant may provide just the relaxation you need.
aka: New Blue Diesel, Blue City Diesel

highlightedReviews.text:
Fantastic, uplifting high - it takes away my neuropathic pain for hours and simultaneously makes me energetic and euphoric - damn fine attributes for one dealing with major depression that has been ameliorated not one whit by Rx anti-depressants.
Toking up on Blue D on a bad morning can turn the day around and your frown upside-down!  Unequivocal recommendation for treating nerve pain and depression.

This is a really nice balanced hybrid for the Indica enthusiast. Iâ€™m used to the Diesel family, & always find them hard hitting when grown properly (esp. a good Sour Diesel), however THIS is hard hitting in a focused grounding manner, that is very relaxing. 10/10 ğŸ’šğŸ†âœ¨

articles.title: 5 Soulful Blues Albums to Listen to While High
articles.author: Rae Lland
articles.text:
The blues is a timeless genre full of heart and soul. Starting in the 19thÂ century, blues formed in black communities of the deep south and has strong roots in African musical traditions. Early blues songs were accompanied by lyrics recounting experiences of racial discrimination and other similar hardships faced by black Americans. The genre has persisted through the years, often being combined with elements of jazz, soul, rock, spirituals, and R&B.

Whatever form it takes, the blues is a genre that grabs you by the heart and demands an emotional response. Below, enjoy five impactful blues albums with our recommended strains and tune in to your emotional center.
Southern Avenue by Southern Avenue
(Spotify)
Strain Pairing Recommendation: Bluniverse
Southern Avenue released its lively self-titled album in 2017 and burst onto the blues scene with a refreshing style. The 10-track album features a full electric band, backup vocals, and versatile lead singer Tierinii Jackson, who wows with her strong, harmonious voice. Jackson is joined by her sister Tikyra Jackson on drums, Ori Naftaly on guitar, Jeremy Powell on keys, and Gage Markey on bass. Together, the five create an upbeat, energetic soundscape on Southern Avenue with an added influence of soul and R&B.
Find Bluniverse Nearby
Didnâ€™t It Rain by Amy Helm
(Spotify)
Strain Pairing Recommendation: Blue Lights
Amy Helm released her breakout album, Didnâ€™t It Rain, in 2015, and has left fans eager for her next project. Helmâ€™s voice, light with a tinge of roughness, is a powerful instrument that pulls your heart out of your chest with each upward lilt. Didnâ€™t It Rain has a southern blues feel with elements of rock that keep it fresh and interesting with each new track. Helmâ€™s lyrics are engaging and soulful, making it a joy to sing along and pour your emotions into every note.
Find Blue Lights Nearby

The Marcus King Band by The Marcus King Band
(Spotify)
Strain Pairing Recommendation: Blue Diesel
The Marcus King BandÂ is a powerful, hard-hitting album released in 2016, and also marks frontman Marcus Kingâ€™s second album. Relatively new to the scene, The Marcus King Band has swept the blues world by storm, with its album reaching No. 2 on Billboardâ€™s blues album chart. The Marcus Kind Band has an intricately rich sound accompanied by gritty heart and Kingâ€™s soulful, raw vocals. Each track on the album features the bandâ€™s perfectly orchestrated and impactful instrumentation with a sweet, mournful essence of blues.
Find Blue Diesel Nearby
By My Side by Kat Wright
(Spotify)
Strain Pairing Recommendation: Blue Mystic
By My Side, released in 2016, is Kat Wrightâ€™s first album, and it wastes no time getting right to the heart of the matter. Wrightâ€™s soulful, longing voice is effortless, whisking you away and holding you close. The music shoots straight to your center as it churns with emotion, all while the eight-piece band captures your attention with playful transitions. By My Side is a breakout album that carves out a prominent spot for Wright and her band in the world of blues.
Find Blue Mystic Nearby

Migration Blues by Eric Bibb
(Spotify)
Strain Pairing Recommendation: Blue Dragon
Migration Blues is smooth like silk. This acoustic blues album, released in 2017, is a raw, more organic approach to blues that eases you back in time to a simpler place. Eric Bibbâ€™s voice is pristine and rich as he sings over his melodic guitar playing. Occasionally accompanied by harmonica, the album is stripped down but drips so heavily with emotion that it feels full and rounded. Itâ€™s the perfect collection of songs to sink into after a long day, cradling you as it drifts you away from your hardships in every note.
Find Blue Dragon Nearby

articles.title: The 13 Best Cannabis Strains for Parties
articles.author: Brett Konen
articles.text:
A lot of people think of alcohol as the classic social lubricant. For some of us, it is. Alcohol can loosen us up, make us chatty and animated, and wash away social anxiety. Itâ€™s also often readily available at social occasions. Meanwhile, many people avoid cannabis use during social eventsâ€”for one thing, itâ€™s generally not served, and for another, many can recall a time cannabis made them paranoid or sleepy at a party, and donâ€™t want to have that happen again.

Luckily, with the right strains you can avoid the unwanted effects mentioned above. We used the advanced filters in Leaflyâ€™s strain explorer to get started, sorting to include strains with the happiest, most talkative highs, and to exclude any strains that make users anxious, paranoid, or sleepy. (If only alcoholâ€™s drawbacks were so easy to filter out, am I right?)
Weâ€™ve curated the resultant list with our in-house expertise, vetting all suggestions against our own experiences and ensuring thereâ€™s a pick for every type of party. Attendees heading to any social occasion will find something below.
And the awards for the best party cannabis strains go toâ€¦
Chocolope
Strain type: Sativa
Best for: All occasions.
DNA Genetics developed Chocolope by crossingÂ Chocolate ThaiÂ withÂ Cannalope Haze to create their homage to the super-popular Chocolate strains of the 1980s. The heftyÂ sativaÂ buds giveÂ earthy, sweetÂ coffeeÂ flavors that provide a dreamy, cerebral effect. Itâ€™s known around the Leafly office as â€œthe party strain,â€ and for good reasonâ€”itâ€™s basically impossible to be unhappy or introverted with such a feel-good high.

White Russian
Strain type: Hybrid
Best for: Dinner parties.
Originally created by Dutch breeders Serious Seeds, White Russian is a cross of two legendary strains,Â White WidowÂ andÂ AK-47. An indica-dominant hybrid, it won theÂ High TimesÂ Cannabis Cup â€œBest Overallâ€Â in 1996. White Russian is an extremely fragrant plant, and with a flavor that is smooth and spicy with undertones of skunk and earth, and its high is quite cerebral (especially for an indica-dominant strain), making it great for conversation with those around you.
Tangie
Strain type: Sativa
Best for: Cocktail parties.
Another fave among the Leafly crew, particularly for group gatherings after work, Tangie is a fantastic offering from DNA Genetics in Amsterdam. This strain is a remake of sorts of the popular version ofÂ Tangerine DreamÂ that was sought-after in the 1990s, with genetics derived from a cross ofÂ California OrangeÂ and aÂ SkunkÂ hybrid. Its citrus heritage is the most evident in its refreshing tangerine aroma.
Blue Goo
Strain type: Hybrid
Best for: Friends and family gatherings.
Blue Goo is a sativa-dominant hybrid thatâ€™s a cross between the famous hybridÂ Blue DreamÂ and indicaÂ Afgoo. A moderate to high potency yields uplifting effects that are standard for sativas, but not excessively energetic thanks to Afgooâ€™s contribution as well as the mellow nature of Blue Dream. This strain is appropriate for day or nighttime consumption and provides smooth smoke and berry flavor.

Sour Lemon OG
Strain type: Hybrid
Best for: Birthday parties.
Bred by Emerald Triangle Seeds, Sour Lemon OG is a sativa-dominantÂ hybridÂ cross betweenÂ California SourÂ andÂ Lemon OG. This 65%Â sativaÂ strain is named after its aromatic sour smell with recognizable notes ofÂ lemon,Â lime, andÂ apple. Sour Lemon OG elevates the mind and body simultaneously, making this a natural go-to strain forÂ celebrations, social engagements, or even just a busy day.
Blue Diesel
Strain type: Hybrid
Best for: Happy hour.
Daughter of indica-dominantÂ BlueberryÂ and sativa-dominantÂ NYC Diesel, Blue Diesel (also known as Blue City Diesel) falls slightly on the indica side of things with a pleasant,Â moderate- to long-lasting body buzz (perfect if you want to extend the happy for more than an hour). Thanks to its Blueberry genetics, this flower emanates a light berry aroma that is smooth, expansive, and fast-acting. This strain is optimal for daytime use, and relaxes the consumer in social settings without putting you to sleep.
Pez
Strain type: Indica
Best for: Cannabis-focused parties.
Pez is anÂ indicaÂ daughter ofÂ AfghaniÂ and Pakistani strains. TheseÂ sweet, frosty buds offer theÂ relaxationÂ typical of indicas without the drowsiness, making the strain great for daytime use.Â We recommend this one as a shareable contribution to any 420-friendly gatheringâ€”itâ€™s also on our list of the Top 100 Must-Try Strains, meaning it will be a particularly popular addition to any event with open cannabis consumption.

Orange Bud
Strain type: Hybrid
Best for: Hosting.
Matching plenty of social energy with a dose of subtle relaxation, this strain is perfect for gatherings where youâ€™re in charge and want to stay upbeat and level-headed. First bred in 1980s by Dutch Passion, Orange Bud is a combination of two members of the 100%Â SkunkÂ family. With bright orange hairs coating the surface, it showcases scents of orange and nectarine.
Blueberry Headband
Strain type: Hybrid
Best for: Parties you donâ€™t want to attend.
Several renditions of the Blueberry Headband hybrid are known to exist, but the original Blueberry Headband from NorCalâ€™s Emerald Triangle Seeds is the most well-known. Itâ€™s a 50/50 indica-sativa hybrid that smells of diesel, berries and pepper, and it produces a perfectly balanced high with a nice cerebral rush and relaxing body effects. This is great for staying sufficiently present while mentally floating high above any social event you wish you didnâ€™t have to attend (think work parties, baby showers, and so on).
Banana Kush
Strain type: Hybrid
Best for: Potlucks.
This legendary West Coast strain crossesÂ Ghost OGÂ andÂ Skunk HazeÂ to create anÂ indica-dominantÂ hybridÂ that tastes and smells like a bushel of freshÂ bananas (and will whet your appetite if thereâ€™s food around). Although it leans towards anÂ indica genetically, the effects are balanced by theÂ Hazeâ€™sÂ mellowÂ sativaÂ buzz that provides aÂ relaxedÂ sense ofÂ euphoria.Â Banana Kush also help its consumers remainÂ talkativeÂ in social settings.

Durban Cookies
Strain type: Sativa
Best for: Loud parties.
Durban Cookies is theÂ Durban Poison-dominantÂ phenotypeÂ ofÂ GSC. Known for its invigorating mental energy and body buzz, Durban Cookies offers a more energizing experience, making this sativa-dominant strain a top choice throughout the day and into the evening, particularly if youâ€™re headed to a high-energy event where youâ€™ll be surrounded by music, people, and movement.
Bubblegum Kush
Strain type: Indica
Best for: Low-key get-togethers.
This strain is for laid-back social situations; itâ€™ll leave you relaxed and comfy on any given couch, but also chatty and ready to hang with whoever sits down next to you. An 80% indica strain from Bulldog Seeds in the Netherlands, Bubblegum Kush is a cross betweenÂ Bubble GumÂ and an undisclosed Kush, and has a satisfyingly sour smell and flavor.
Strawberry
Strain type: Sativa
Best for: Being a plus-one.
Originally bred in the Netherlands, Strawberry is a mostly sativa cannabis strain with a pungent fruity scent and uplifting effects. Consumers prone to anxiety choose Strawberry for its stress-relieving qualities without the jarring paranoia common among high-THC strains (which makes it great for small talk with people you donâ€™t know). Comfortable and relaxing, Strawberry brings with it a hearty dose of physical and mental ease.
